intro: Pseudoselago outeniquensis, commonly known as the Outeniqua bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
